posts.name: Jacob Mertz
posts.cooked:
I am the lead programmer for team 3767 TC Titans, and this year we made the decision to do a full CTRE swerve drive to utilize the generated swerve system. The swerve drive is made up of MK4n swerve modules with the L3+ gearing and Kraken X60’s for both drive and steer. After we got the swerve built and the new CTRE Swerve project generated, the robot seemed to drive fine, however the steering motors seemed to jitter along the path to their setpoint. We have chopped this up to a PID issue, however after spending several hours trying to tune it to stop doing this, I couldn’t figure out what is going wrong. even when everything other than P is set to zero, and P is incredibly low, the modules jitter along their path even when not making it to the setpoint.

The chassis drives fine, and after tuning the PID a little bit despite this issue, the modules snap right to place and haven’t yet had any issues with drift or other common swerve issues. The only problem is that the modules are incredibly noisy, and I am concerned for the lifespan of the gears.

For software we are using all of the most recent 2025 versions of the WPIlib,  NI, and CTRE software suites. The only code changed from what is generated by Tuner X is the code for controller input, as we are using PS5 controllers rather than Xbox. However even when using an Xbox controller for input (using the controller code that is generated by Tuner X) the issue persists.

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked:
you’ll want to post a link to your GitHub so that folks can see your code.

also link to a video showing the problem.

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: it would also be good to show an example of the data produced: commanded steering angle, actual angle, motor output, etc, for one of the steering mechanisms.

posts.name: Jackson Hochstetler
posts.cooked: I’ll have access to the robot in a couple hours, I’ll post a video and some data then

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas
posts.cooked:
JCM:

everything other than P is set to zero

It sounds like the feed forward is too high with KS and KV . Do you mean you have set the KI, KD, KS, KV , KA = 0?

https://firstinmichigan.us/ FRC /frc-swerve-drive-build-series/

There is a video specifically on tuning the steering motors.

link_counts.title: FRC Swerve Drive Build Series – FRC

posts.name: Jacob Mertz
posts.cooked: Yes, all the feed forwards had been set to zero along with kI and kD.

posts.name: Jackson Hochstetler
posts.cooked:
Here is a link to the code: github.com/jckitkat/2025-Robot

And here is a video IMG_8620.MOV - Google Drive

edit: this is with all the values in the current version of the github repo, this is just the result of trying a bunch of things

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: looks kinda normal to me.  i would definitely put this issue at the bottom of your to-do list.

posts.name: joel truher
posts.cooked: oh also, when the wheels are actually in contact with the carpet, they do this less, because there’s a ton of friction.

posts.name: jleibs
posts.cooked:
Did you make any progress getting to the bottom of this issue?

We just brought up our CTRE swerve drive w/ Krakens (L1 gearing instead of L3) and I believe we may be seeing something very similar.

Driving itself is not awful, but the sound that it makes is very concerning compared to our other swerve drive. We are able to actually see visible stuttering in the angle as well.

I’ve been hypothesizing maybe over-sensitivity to rotational components of the command input, possibly near the dead-band, but haven’t managed to observe anything definitive in the logged data yet.

I’ll grab a video of the problem on monday or tuesday.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked:
The generated gains are expected to be tuned. Tune your steer gains in TunerConstants to track as accurately as possible on the ground, preferably with carpet without oscillating.

Oscillation with it up in the air is expected. You may still see oscillation on the ground, on carpet, due to mechanical differences between robots. I recommend reading through Closed-Loop Overview

posts.name: khope
posts.cooked: Sorry if this is a dumb question, but is there a documented procedure for tuning the steering gains?  Is it just changing the values and seeing how it behaves?  Last year we were able to to just take the generated constants file and plugged it in to the SwerveWithPathPlanner project and didn’t experience any chattering.  But this year we are experiencing the chatter.  Thanks for any guidance you (or others) can provide.

Video archive of FIRST in Michigan FRC Competition Matches

One these videos shows how they do it…

posts.name: khope
posts.cooked: Thanks.  I watched these video last night and they explained it perfectly.  Haven’t had a chance to try it yet, but at least we now know how.

suggested_topics.title: Can no longer find Limelight after working fine previous day
suggested_topics.excerpt: I had it wired Incorrectly, I had a PoE cable running from the radio not to it, so once I changed that and just used a normal ethernet cable from Aux 1 to the limelight that solved the problem
